alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains; Okanogan Highlands; Okanogan Valley; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 20 at 3:20AM PST until January 21 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation of freezing rain and occasional snow. Ice accumulations around one tenth of an inch. Snow accumulation of less than an inch in the valleys. * WHERE...Wenatchee area, Waterville Plateau, Okanogan Valley and Highlands, Northeast Washington Mountains and the north Idaho Panhandle. * WHEN...Until noon PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Idaho, for the latest road information in Idaho, call 5 1 1. In Washington, for the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Mountains; Okanogan Highlands; Okanogan Valley; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area
